titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Harry Atwood Film Collection, 1949-1995.

profiledesc.creation: Edited with XMetal 2 by Cherie Baker and Evan Hocker according to instructions in TARO 2 EAD 2002 Editing Instructions. 20030825.

did.head: Descriptive Summary

extref.corpname: Dolph Briscoe Center for American History, The University of Texas at Austin

did.abstract: Short documentary films which yield sensory impressions of the visions of the creator.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Harry Atwood is a graduate of the University of Arizona from which he holds a Bachelors and a Masters in Music and a film graduate from the University of Southern California in Los Angeles. He has made over sixty films, but only calls thirty his own creations or impressions. His focus has shifted from people to nature, because he says it has so much more to say. His films have won blue ribbons from the American Film Festival and Golden Eagle Awards for international non-theatrical events.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Short films created by award-winning documentary filmmaker Harry Atwood combine music and sounds of nature with visual images to express his impressions of specific places or events. Films include: The Great Unfenced (1963), about a cattle station in the outback of western Australia; Paths in the Wilderness (1976), concerning the missions of Padre Kino in southern Arizona and northern Mexico; and High on the Wild (1987), impressions of the Alaska wilderness and its dramatic landscape. The collection also contains Atwood's notes relating to each film and on-location photographs and sound recordings.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are listed by title of film or event filmed.
The dates given for the films refer to the date of release; filming itself usually occurred one year prior to the date listed.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restriction
accessrestrict.p: Restricted access to portions of this collection; all copyright restrictions apply. Portions of this collection are stored remotely. Advance notice is required for retrrieval. Contact repository for retrieval.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Advance notice required for viewing videocassettes. Tapes may be copied for research purposes for a fee.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: The original master videotape versions of Harry Atwood's films are located in the Consolidated Film Industries laboratory in Los Angeles, California.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Harry Atwood Film Collection, 1949-1995, Dolph Briscoe Center for American History, The University of Texas at Austin.

did.unittitle: SEVENTEEN FILMS ON DIGITAL VIDEO DISCS (DVD):
*Adagio, impressions of Venice in winter, 1984 [from first master] (VHS from 2nd Master is best; see pg. 2).
American Realists, a survey of realism in American painting from the 18th century into the 20th century, 1965
Back of Beyond, life in the Hebridean Islands off the west coast of Scotland, 1983
Bellota, a month long roundup on a large cattle ranch in southern Arizona, 1969
Cajititlan, life in a Mestizo village in Jalisco, Mexico, 1965
Fantasmas, remains of the Inca Empire in an awesome setting, the Andes of Peru, 1978
**Fever, Carnival in Bahia, Brazil, 1977 (best VHS is from extra 3/4″; see pg. 3)
Fire on the Sea, the people (and volcanoes) of the islands of Sicily and Stromboli, 1980
Genesis, forces of nature filmed on the islands of Maui and Hawaii: sea, tropical storm and eruption of the volcano, Kilauea, 1985
The Great Unfenced, a cattle station on the Great Western Desert of Australia, 1963
High on the Wild, some impressions of Alaska, sea life, glaciers, etc., 1987
John Marin, the great oils and watercolors of the brilliant American painter, 1968
Journey Through Eden, tribal music and dance, landscape and animals of East Africa, 1975
Mokum, Amsterdam in autumn, impressions of a beautiful, unique and lively city, 1990
Paths in the Wilderness, Padre Kino and his missions in Sonora, Mexico, and southern Arizona, 1976
Sagaland, some impressions of Iceland, Europe's greatest waterfalls, glacier and fantastic landscapes, 1989
Tiger by the Tail, a 72-year-old alcoholic's road to recovery, 1970
Winter Light, some impressions of Norway from Oslo to Bergen, 1991
Yankee Painter, the drawings, watercolors and oils of Winslow Homer, 1964
Summer Odyssey, filmed in Europe and Russia, 1972
Bridge to the East, filmed in the Orient, 1973
*Adagio, 1984, [Best VHS copy from better second master]

Charles Burchfield 1966/ Masterpiece of Spanish Painting,
1961
Terra Sancta Revisited, filmed in Israel, 1968 [revised version]
Journey Thru Eden/ **Fever, filmed in East Africa and Brazil [extra VHS copy; best VHS copy of Fever]
Television interviews of Harry Atwood, January 1969, March 1981, February 1983

note.p: (can be used for making VHS dubs for general use. Best quality VHS or 3/4″ cassette dubs should be made from one inch Sub-Masters or one inch Masters).

Mexico, filming with Connie Helmericks, summer, 1957
